Parchments, Please.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: So, you're the squirt that runs this place now?
Ehehehe, little young I'd say, but I suppose we'll see in time.
I'm <color=purple>Deidre Downton</color>- but you probably knew that. After all, my brewing prowess is unrivaled across all of Kastonia!
But don't get too starstruck dearie- so long as you keep my lips wet, you and I will be square!
By the way... I don't see your bartending certification hung up anywhere. That might prove to be an issue.
Don't get me wrong- I'll still be ordering something. Just figured you might want to rectify that quickly, ehehehe~

Deidre can Help.Name: Deidre can Help
Stanzas: Hmm? You're looking at me funny, dearie.
Ehehe! Then again, you always look funny.
You're concerned about the quake from earlier, hmm? Don't fret, why don't you let Auntie Deidre go figure it out?
I'll be back tomorrow with everything you need to know. Just hand me that little quest contract and I'll be on my way... after you give me a little something to drink for the trouble.

Deidre Returns.Name: Hello World
Stanzas: Never fear, my dear- I've returned with the requested information despite its... foreboding nature... eheheheh~

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Morning, dearie. Glad to see your bar starting to flourish with each passing day!
Of course, you have a long way to go before you reach my level of success, hmm?
Ehehehe... for future notice, the quicker you serve me a drink, the quicker I'll quit teasing you!

Introduction.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: What's up, barkeep? By the way, I should probably introduce myself- you'll be seeing a lot of me!
Name's <color=#00FF7F>Artemis Cagosh</color>, but that's such a mouthful. You should just call me <color=#00FF7F>Artie</color>.
And don't worry- this thing ain't for bashin' skulls- well, not yours, at least!
It's mainly for gettin' rid of some of the more hefty chunks of rock down in the mines... heh, you know what I mean?
Er, sorry- didn't mean to talk your ear off.
What, you need me to pick something up from City Hall? Well sure, pal! A quick drink might be appreciated though.

AfterExplosion.Name: AfterExplosion
Stanzas: Man, you won't believe the day I had, barkeep...
Or, uh, maybe you will, dependin' on whether or not you felt that quake from here, heh.
Point is, the mines've collapsed, and I'm outta work for a bit.
Not really sure what to do in the meantime, but figure a drink might help me for a bit.

Artie Can Help.Name: Artie Can Help
Stanzas: Say, barkeep? Without a job, I don't have much to do.
If there's anything I can help you with, lemme know.
I ain't good at much, but I got a muscle or two I can leverage.
That is, so long as I'm hydrated, hah!

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Hey pal! Glad to see a friendly face, 'specially considerin' the recent events.
Everyone's losin' their heads over this Spire thing, and I gotta tell you, I'm not quite sure what to make of it.
I just wish there was a way to help more, y'know?
Anyways, pass me a drink- gotta hankerin' for one of your brews!

Introduction.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: The name's <color=yellow>Horace R. Schuster</color> and, I assure you, the pleasure's all mine.
This is such a quaint little pub you have here- much more modest than the ritzy establishments I'd frequent in my youth!
Those places were so lifeless and ostentatious though, I much more greatly appreciate the modest decor you have here!
But I shan't waste any more of your precious time, and will get straight to the point.

AfterExplosion.Name: AfterExplosion
Stanzas: My goodness! Did you hear that?
'Twas enough to ruin an old man's already poor hearing.
Something that powerful must have impacted dozens of civilians. I'm fortunate to have been here, unaffected. And yet, I now have a responsibility to aid those who were.
Friend, I have always dreamed of becoming an adventurer, but my family business prevented me from doing so. Perhaps this is a chance to change all that.
If you hear of anything that suits my talents, please, allow me to help.
In the meantime, I'd love to partake in another of your finest brews.

Horace Can Help.Name: Horace Can Help
Stanzas: Greetings, friend! I've been told you could use a hand with relief efforts!
Well, fortunately for you, I have, not one, but two hands right here!
I may not have the strength of my youth, but I've found how to wield words over the years.
Come now! First a drink, and then I'll be on my way.

Conversation1.Name: Conversation1
Stanzas: Ah, there's my favorite bartender. Although it's not as if I frequent any other establishment, ho ho!
Have you been hearing about the protests up in the Borough? I imagine the Corporeal doesn't appreciate the civil unrest at their doorstep one bit!
It makes an old man wish there was more he could do in times like this, to help the next generation.
...it also tends to make me quite parched! Ho ho ho!

Your Civic Duty.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: So you're the altruistic bartender who's been helping coordinate disaster relief after Tuesday's events, hmm? I must say, it's a pleasure to meet you.
The name's <color=purple>Nell</color>. I'm a freelance journalist, and I'm interested in writing a quick spot about this bar, if you don't mind?
Oh, who am I kidding, of course you don't. There's no such thing as bad publicity!
That being said, there's no such thing as a bad free drink either... if you catch my drift?

Introduction.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: I don't mean to, er, come off as disrespectful- I imagine you're probably busy! And believe me, I know what it's like to be busy.
But, um... well, I represent the <color=blue>College of Magical Research and Recovery</color>, and, um... well, thanks to your actions, you've kind of brought us to an impasse.
Although we at the College didn't call for the citizens to protest, we would have benefitted greatly, if, y'know, they'd succeeded.
Please don't get me wrong though! I'm not here to chew you out or anything. I just need you to know what's at stake here.
Because, if we at the College are right (and we often are)...
...then there's a terrible storm brewing on the horizon.

Introduction.Name: Introduction
Stanzas: I wish not to impede your financial gains, as you have impeded the <color=blue>Corporeal's</color> efforts, so I will be brief.
We understand the public's thirst for information, but there is a reason for our secrecy.
For you see, our city is in more danger than anyone yet realizes.
And things are about to get much, much worse.
...or maybe that confused look on your face means that you're still working on learning the ropes? Hah!

Now You Know Me.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Name's <color=orange>Jim</color>. I've been a patron of your parents since they opened this place!
...you still seem a little rattled. Tell you what, why don't I give you a helping hand! It's the least I can do for your parents' decades of service.
To start off, why don't you make me a <color=yellow>drink</color>? Been a while since I've had one of your parent's expert brews.
It shouldn't be all that hard. Each of the taps are <color=yellow>color-coded</color> after all, ho ho!

Jim Explains Rumors.Name: Jim Explains Rumors
Stanzas: Whoa there- looks like one of your patrons has given you a <color=yellow>quest</color>!
...what're you giving me that look for? You didn't think that serving drinks was your ONLY job as a bartender, right?
Whether wittingly or unwittingly, people tend to spill all sorts of <color=yellow>interesting problems</color> to whomever provides them alcohol.
It's up to you to help resolve these issues in the most efficient way- by passing them off to another patron and bribing them with drinks- ho ho!
This first one's easy- you just need someone to pick up your bartending certification, right?
Why not just ask the first person to come through the bar next? I'll take a seat in the back, just in case.

EndDay1.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Looks like you had a fairly successful first day!
I'm gonna head on out so you can close up shop, but don't worry- I'll be here bright and early in the morn'!

Day 2 Intro.Name: Jim
Stanzas: Mornin', kid! Y'know, I'm starting to get used to it being you behind that bar instead of your folks.
Despite your age, you actually make for a pretty good barkeep. Ho ho!
Now then, why don't you pour me a-

The Commotion.Name: Jim
Stanzas: ...holy smokes- kid, did you feel that?
I don't think it's just me... I only had a couple drinks before stopping by!
Felt almost like an <color=red>earthquake</color>, but a lot more violent and sudden. I wonder what's happened?
Whoa, whoa, hold on now- I see that look of eager curiosity in your eyes, but you've got a bar to run, right?
Why don't you have send another one of your patrons off? I know Deidre is a fairly perceptive lass, she may be best suited to the task.
And it'll give you the opportunity to keep doing your job! Speaking of which...

After Sending Deidre.Name: Jim
Stanzas: And now we wait! Ol' <color=purple>Deidre</color> may be a little... eccentric, but I can speak to her reliability.
Also, you may have realized this already, but your efforts to help out don't go unnoticed.
The more tasks you hand out to folks, the more chummy they'll tend to be with you.
And who knows? Maybe you'll end up <color=yellow>learning something new about them</color> in the process!
Anways, I'm gonna go nurse this drink in the back for a while and let you tend the bar. Best of luck!

Answer the Call.Name: Answer the Call
Stanzas: So I take it you've heard the news by now, hmm? After all, it's not like you can't see it from here, ho ho!
Of course, I don't mean to make light of this situation. The <color=yellow>Spire</color> has been our benefactor of magical power for as long as anyone can remember.
After all, that's why Kastonia was built around that looming tower!
But I digress... there's not much that can be done about the <color=yellow>Spire</color> now, but the devastation caused by yesterday's event is still very present.
I know this isn't quite what you signed up for, kid, but maybe you could see about sending another patron off to provide aid? The city could use it.
Here, I'll hand this off to you while you think it over.

GDC Tutorial End.Name: GDC Tutorial End
Stanzas: Goodness! That sounded rather foreboding, didn't it? I wonder what they meant by that.
Unfortunately for you, the devs aren't willing to divulge that information quite yet. What a bunch of teases, ho ho!
However, I have good news. If you're interested in keeping up with this game's development cycle, you can follow the devs on Twitter!
Check them out at <color=yellow>@ArmsAndAle</color>, and give them a follow! I'm sure they'd appreciate it.
Well, alright kid. That's about all I've got for now. Hopefully I'll be seeing you soon.
Watch out for the release of <color=yellow>'A Tale of Arms and Ale'</color> this coming May!
